alert.note: Alert for Socorro (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 6:21PM MDT until August 03 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following counties, Socorro and Torrance. * WHEN...Until 930 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 617 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms over Arroyo Chupadera and Arroyo Rancho Viejo. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of 1 inch will be possible. The potential exists for flash flooding to exist. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of East Central Socorro and Southwestern Torrance Counties - This includes the following highways... Highway 380 between Mile Markers 18 and 22. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Both localized and distant heavy rainfall will create sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos and over low water crossings.
